Banach-Alaoglu, Hahn-Banach, operator theory

Let XXX and YYY be Banach spaces. A bounded linear transformation A ⁣:X→Y\func{A}{X}{Y}A:X→Y is compact if for every bounded sequence {xn}⊆X\set{x_n} \subseteq X{xn​}⊆X, the sequence {Axn}n\set{Ax_n}_n{Axn​}n​ has a convergent subsequence in YYY. Suppose XXX is reflexive (X∗∗=XX^{**} = XX∗∗=X) and X∗X^*X∗ is separable. Solution.

The condition on the subsequence {xnj}j\set{x_{n_j}}_j{xnj​​}j​ implies that

"  ⟹  \implies⟹"

By applying Banach-Alaoglu to X∗X^*X∗, we see that the ball BR∗∗={x∈X∗∗∣∥x∥≤R}B^{**}_R = \set{x \in X^{**} \mid \norm{x} \leq R}BR∗∗​={x∈X∗∗∣∥x∥≤R} is weakly compact. By reflexivity of XXX, this implies that BR={x∈X∣∥x∥≤R}B_R = \set{x \in X \mid \norm{x} \leq R}BR​={x∈X∣∥x∥≤R} is weakly compact.

Given {xn}n⊆X\set{x_n}_n \subseteq X{xn​}n​⊆X, weak compactness implies existence of a subsequence {xnj}j\set{x_{n_j}}_j{xnj​​}j​ which converges weakly to some φ∈X\phi \in Xφ∈X. Passing to another subsequence if needed, compactness of AAA implies that {Axnj}j\set{Ax_{n_j}}_j{Axnj​​}j​ converges strongly to some yyy in XXX. It remains to show that y=Aφy = A\phiy=Aφ.

Let f∈Y∗f \in Y^*f∈Y∗, and so
